page.title: 01Preston on Wye Area
page.content: Preston on Wye Blakemere and Byford lie in the river valley on either side of the Wye. All are fairly scattered villages of farms and cottages; each has its own church. The landscape is intensively farmed, maily with cercals, beet, oilseed rape, cattle, sheep and some market garden crops and orchards. There is goods fishing in the Wye, and shooting also. Housing is a mixture of old and new, with a small modern development at Poingrifield in Preston on Wye. Most local employment is in agriculture, but many people travel in hereford offices and factories and to the satillite station at Madley, Childrem travel to neighbouring villages to school, entertainment locally is through clubs or events such as whilst drives and dances.
